full_summary:
# Tender Announcement

## Traffic Control Services for NCC Quebec Urban Lands and Gatineau Park

**Solicitation Number**: MA065
**Amendment Number**: 1
**Reference Number**: PW-23-01024838
**Tender Closing Date**: March 9, 2023, at 3:00 PM EST
**Publication Date**: February 6, 2023
**Publication URL**: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr

The National Capital Commission (NCC) is seeking a contractor to provide traffic control services in the province of Quebec for its summer and fall programs. The contractor is required to provide traffic management operations at Gatineau Park's popular sites, which tend to reach their capacity during the summer and fall seasons.

**Duration**: The contract term will be for three (3) years, commencing on the date of award and ending on March 31, 2026. The NCC has the option to extend the contract term by up to two (2) additional one (1) year periods.

**Trade Agreements**: This procurement process is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Bid Requirements**: Bids must be submitted electronically via email to [Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca](mailto:Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca) by the specified deadline. Faxed and hard copy bids will not be accepted.

**Inquiries**: All inquiries must be directed to Micheline Al-Koutsi, Senior Contract Officer, via email at [micheline.al-koutsi@ncc-ccn.ca](mailto:micheline.al-koutsi@ncc-ccn.ca) by March 1, 2023. Responses to inquiries will be provided through addenda, which will be posted on canadabuys.canada.ca.

**Selection Criteria**: Offers must comply with all requirements of the contract and the Request for Standing Offer to be declared responsive. The responsive offer with the lowest total evaluated price will be recommended for issuance of a contract and a Standing Offer Agreement.

**Tender Documents**: All tender documents, including the Request for Proposal, Contract and Standing Offer Agreement, and appendices, are available for download on canadabuys.canada.ca.

**Contracting Entity**: National Capital Commission
**Contact Information**: AlKoutsi, Micheline, micheline.al-koutsi@ncc-ccn.ca, 613-239-5678
